papers.title: Credit default swaps and systemic risk
papers.citation: R. Cont, Andreea Minca (2014). Credit default swaps and systemic risk. Annals of Operations Research. Citations: 60, Influential: 4.

summary (tldr).text: It is found that, when interest rate swaps are cleared, central clearing of credit default swaps through a well-capitalized CCP can reduce the probability and the magnitude of a systemic illiquidity spiral by reducing the length of the chains of critical receivables within the financial network.

papers.title: Least Susceptible Networks to Systemic Risk
papers.citation: Ryota Zamami, Hiroshi Sato, A. Namatame (2014). Least Susceptible Networks to Systemic Risk. Unknown Journal. Citations: 3, Influential: 0.

summary (tldr).text: This paper designs the least susceptible network to systemic risk in the threshold-based cascade model and proposes the network design model in which the associated adjacency matrix has the largest maximum eigenvalue.
